project.teaser: CAFEIN aims at facilitating the design and subsequent adoption by national innovation funding agencies (members of the Innovation Funding Advisory Board) of an inclusive and cross border joint action plan to support the green industrial transition of their SMEs. The action...
project.objective: CAFEIN aims at facilitating the design and subsequent adoption by national innovation funding agencies (members of the Innovation Funding Advisory Board) of an inclusive and cross border joint action plan to support the green industrial transition of their SMEs. The action plan will participate to make Europe climate neutral by 2050 with improved circular economy, resource efficiency and resilience, building European industrial value chains. The project uses a bottom-up approach, where national cluster associations act as facilitators and innovation ecosystem experts for national funding agencies. Having associations of clusters as partners will allow to efficiently engage and connect all stakeholders of the quadruple helix (public authorities, start-ups, SMEs, large companies, investors, research and innovation actors, academia, incubators and business servicCAFEIN aims at facilitating the design and subsequent adoption by national innovation funding agencies (members of the project’s Innovation Funding Advisory Board) of an inclusive joint action plan to support the green industrial transition of their SMEs. This joint action plan will participate to make Europe climate neutral by 2050 with improved circular economy, resource efficiency and resilience, building European industrial value chains. The project uses a bottom-up approach, where association of clusters act as facilitators and ecosystems experts for national funding agencies. Having associations of clusters as partners will allow to efficiently engage and connect all the quadruple helix’s stakeholders (public authorities, start-ups, SMEs, large companies, investors, research and innovation actors, academia, incubators and business service providers). Citizens will also be addressed, making them aware on the green industrial transition and collaboration challenges and opportunities. Furthermore, the partners will represent innovation leaders and less advanced innovation ecosystems, leaving no one behind.
project.title: Cluster Action For Ecosystem Innovation Network
project.keywords: Green industrial transition, circular economy, cross-border collaboration, transition challenges, inclusion, bottom-up approach, quadruple helix stakeholders

article.title: Pushing for a green industrial transition

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - CAFEIN (Cluster Action For Ecosystem Innovation Network)
result.teaser: The CAFEIN aims to prepare a joint long-term action plan, based on a five-year programme, to address green and associated industrial transition challenges through national cluster associations (the project partners) and national innovation funding agencies (members of an...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Recommendation's report of the relevant support measures for international collaboration between Member States
result.description: This deliverable will provide a mapping of existing international collaborations of the IFAB members and recommendations on how to improve the alignment of the national innovation policies and deliver more inter-connected innovation ecosystems

result.title: Report on the support activities for the joint action plan’s implementation (replicability, synergies and co-funding opportunities
result.description: This deliverable will summarise the different activities conducted to support the establishment of the joint action plan.

result.title: Mapping of the existing innovation policies across Europe
result.description: The deliverable will present the existing innovation policies and policy instruments in the countries of interest for CAFEIN, as well as associated emerging funding opportunities to support to green industrial transition challenges. The deliverable will then highlight the gaps between the different innovations policies.

result.title: Report providing the analysis on gender equality issues and recommendation
result.description: This deliverable will analyse the good practices, the gaps and the lessons learnt in each of the partner’s countries to better integrate Women in the European Innovation Ecosystems.

result.title: Joint Action plan
result.description: This deliverable will present the list of actions to be implemented, the timeline and a set of indicators.

result.title: 5-year programme
result.description: This deliverable will present the main thematic where support is needed, the possible synergies between countries and how to include future partners.

result.title: Report on the ecosystem’s needs and gap analysis
result.description: This deliverable will present the gaps between the concrete industrial SMEs needs and the existing innovation policies and instruments

result.title: Report on the five webinars conducted to involve and communicate towards citizens at national level
result.description: This deliverable will gather small reports on the events organised towards citizens, and will draft some recommendations on how to best address citizens on R&D&I thematic.

result.title: Report on the implementation of the communication and dissemination activities, including the matchmaking events
result.description: This deliverable will present all the communication and dissemination activities conducted during the project and their impact on the project’s development.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
